011C3C92DA9F4F67B11253F9CAF6C34A.description: Conduct research such as interviewing employers to identify the qualities of a successful apprentice.

2BE7E22A805F44CD8303C3352CF59D0C.description: Develop an understanding of available programs to help transition from secondary school to apprenticeship.

B222E5136EE64ABCAB1C9EB38E288E1B.description: Determine the steps involved in becoming an apprentice from the perspective of the specific trade, including length of apprenticeship, annual training requirements, and Red Seal certification.

A0A71FF4E62D488A9C44AF55B7D2EBD9.description: Use and understand the appropriate terminology related to apprenticeship including but not limited to: journeyperson, indenture, pre-employment training, designated trade and sub-trade, advanced standing.

25AD103C6C5848D99639794E696F0D0E.description: Research and define what apprenticeship means, and describe some of the benefits such as lifestyle, satisfaction, opportunities, wages, and respect.

4832A7F325FF494DA642FB6F720BFA15.description: Investigate the apprenticeship and trade certification process and the role of the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission (SATCC), opportunities that apprenticeship offers, and the relationship between secondary level courses and apprenticeship training.

063E0E77DB264BCF81BCB9C68DBA7B90.description: Prepare and present a report on the work study experience including aspects such as: expected hours of work, dress code, job description, employer expectations, employer evaluation process, absent and late policies, personal relationships, problem solving.

DA0A37643D764AD3BCADF1D000FACBBE.description: Design and participate in an exit interview with the workplace.

09862EEAD25B4952A628F7ECE0BCF35E.description: Reflect and report on the work experience including, but not limited to, hours of work, personal relationships, employer expectations, evaluation criteria, and overall personal performance.

47E5B71DCD3544D99EC5F24DCAC0ABB2.description: Identify and report on essential skills and employability skills as they relate to a work environment.

7BA8C7BCBDEC4A60AD30C34B34313813.description: Establish standards of work performance acceptable to the student and employer.

A03EBA1D4DC24B98B8469062770DD333.description: Gain an opportunity to develop entry-level workplace skills that may lead to sustainable employment in the construction and carpentry industry.

B7BA8EE3685741AD95D8793EA1299B13.description: Develop an awareness of career opportunities in Saskatchewan and beyond.

B88482E7998F47669102B5FD36770561.description: Gain experience in the world of work in the construction and carpentry industry to make informed career choices by expanding career research and exploration beyond the classroom.

B8B7C29F64D14FCCBBE3176CF047BC4A.description: Practise effective interview techniques based on established guidelines (e.g., the greeting, the exchange, and the parting).

B42F0B30A57A4CD3A06DF18F350F6688.description: Develop a resumé that can be forwarded to potential employers.

13BF166163884E31A9956CD29D3A46F7.description: Discuss effective and positive verbal and non-verbal communication in the workplace.

0DE6DAFDF59944A987A7B2C5174C1327.description: Brainstorm a list of factors which may affect workplace performance.

11AC94002C0B48549F8C293B9AD8CFFB.description: Obtain a list of roles and responsibilities of the workplace.

DDC787BF13A94F2A9D50198F2B5BE733.description: Recognize how school-based skills development is used to meet workplace expectations.

5152D3B9B51D4AEDB49AC4696CED738F.description: Demonstrate knowledge and skills required for layout and cutting of material, joinery (rabbet, dado, dovetail, finger joint), edge banding, making raised panel doors, and installing hinges, drawer slides, and pulls.

DCA7CA26977F4E24BF95EEB262086F5C.description: Demonstrate appropriate techniques to prepare and apply finish.

9B4081FA8B894014BFE400D95CFFC19E.description: Use the appropriate processes to assemble the project such as dry fit, glue, clamp, and use fasteners.

B7DD7BE6FD02416CBF680B23DD6AEB91.description: Cut and fit effective joints (e.g., blind dado, rabbet, mortise and tenon) using systems such as splines, biscuits, and dowels.

8FD7715B01BD4A518C27878109F9303F.description: Demonstrate safe set-up and operation of the required handheld and stationary power tools to cut, surface, and shape.

21EEA57CEA474919BB78344AFC8AE0B5.description: Utilize working drawings (i.e., material list, cutting list, assembly diagram) to accurately measure and layout stock.

AA962955E4694EF0982F2A2FE15A8B29.description: Demonstrate the skills and knowledge required to construct a cabinetry project using a frame and panel process.

F0DCD204EBFB41F79533E77DB300EF15.description: Demonstrate how to layout and assemble a straight stairway.

239099DF1085460582B05B9AFC4F5CAF.description: Utilize basic staircase terminology such as stringer, tread, baluster, riser, and newel post.

169DEABDE4EE4F47BF57816EF89FF0F5.description: Identify various styles of residential stairways including straight, u-shaped, curved, circular, and closed and open stairwells.

2F3B327F95AF4A9887A27B927C805D53.description: Demonstrate an understanding of layout and assembly of a straight stairway.

AE0EC7DA2B1741008803A9AA5629328A.description: Demonstrate the installation of millwork such as baseboard and casing.

47B7F23DFFE74B0399BA545B77B8AE71.description: Research types of flooring (e.g., hardwood, laminate, vinyl, carpet, tile) and their advantages.

1559DC08A4D2463EB70F190F18E7CA15.description: Investigate purposes and functions of various types of interior cabinets.

A7D50970C6544BFE8546A6D8D1CC7652.description: Demonstrate how to hang various interior doors.

C0842851E9214DC0B63C6C97D870C2AC.description: Investigate wall and ceiling finishes (e.g., paint, suspended ceilings, and spray finishes).

75941529640E44D9A4842E09F14ED210.description: Demonstrate the techniques for installing drywall (i.e., boarding, and taping) and/or other selected wall finishes.

203499BFB05E48F8A41249F5593633E7.description: Demonstrate an understanding of common interior finishing materials and their application.

47823451E7F7438A9DDE9607BC4B8A07.description: Identify various types of ventilation and their relationship to moisture control within a residential building.

95854F4601F54FADB5D8ABAEC9B88810.description: Demonstrate proper techniques of installing a selected type of insulation.

763C442A02A145BEAD671D54EE528BD1.description: Investigate various types of insulation materials (e.g., fibreglass, spray foam, rigid foam) and explain their relative R-value.

038F6E80D82548F8851D96DBB3625693.description: Demonstrate an understanding of insulation and vapour barrier and industry standard techniques for application.

C7B21F1E96754D9CBD97719D71B3E558.description: Explain the purpose and installation procedures for eavestroughs and downspouts.

4F68FDBE14684F6A812CB4831618B1F9.description: Demonstrate the procedures to install soffit and fascia.

F05B876460DA4BD28E2A7F120206CA36.description: Demonstrate the procedures to install siding including starting, corners, buildouts, and openings.

54706B1CEAAD442FA8D89C1357090F94.description: Investigate common types of exterior finishes (e.g., vinyl, stucco, wood siding) and explain their relative advantages.

5FEE419053A4495E8F5502476B6C6D26.description: Identify the purposes and installation procedures of building paper and/or housewrap.

EEA68E4345F74EF68A4F71C48D2BBFE8.description: Understand the purpose and application of exterior finish to a residential building.

B5DD7C36E6B94D09844730F636AFD649.description: Demonstrate the installation of door locksets.

A6BF63C3715A4431A30A8619CB5BFB74.description: Demonstrate how to install and plumb an exterior door.

4D15EC1ED7794047817D807E83C271FC.description: Identify styles and parts of a door and frame.

9874264EA3F241BFBD6D67E3D3577FBB.description: Demonstrate how to install a window paying attention to the house wrap, levelling using shims, caulking, and flashing.

4244BC83B6D9404390F76FBAE97C515C.description: Identify window parts, types, styles, cladding, and glazing, and justify selections for a given purpose.

075D72082AA940D2AC5212DEF103BDE7.description: Demonstrate an understanding of how to select and install windows and doors using industry standards.

DBAF6B19F9AD431FAB1BB6EFE4FC763E.description: Investigate and describe the advantages and disadvantages of various roofing materials such as asphalt, rolled roofing, wood shingle and shakes, metal, and tiles.

EC21D17F4A864B6FA1E28913386C7C57.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the correct method of applying shingles to a roof.

7D285599F08243C298665094753E07E3.description: Demonstrate a working knowledge of roofing terms such as underlayment, a square, deck, courses, lap, exposure, and flashing.

646282FDDFB041B4B366DE4E5E0E306F.description: Demonstrate an understanding of a number of materials and practices as applied to the roofing of residential buildings.

DC98F70C575A46AEA308216380C68556.description: Investigate roof truss systems and determine their advantages and disadvantages over site-built rafters.

90EF2D728CF644A18183900F07B13696.description: Investigate and describe the advantages and disadvantages for roof styles such as gable, gambrel, shed, mansard and hip.

AF98F1FF50DB48A3869619FAF99909B6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of industry standard practice to apply roof sheathing.

2ABD29947CF2445D82D1834EA93BF87F.description: Identify the characteristics and purposes of components of rafter assemblies such as common rafters, ridgeboard, ceiling joists, and collar ties.

0CCCB4F5C7234D4EAD700BE1CF500A82.description: Demonstrate the layout and cut of a common rafter including determining line length, location of bird’s mouth, fascia, and soffit cut lines.

98E6AC8B93E64C1D8268C9B888AE1C64.description: Illustrate practices used in various roof designs using the correct terminology.

C484E898DA764DA6843046AF6F96A535.description: Create an assessment of personal skills, attitudes, work habits, and the final product.

24062A1F0EC741E98283EBCD8FDF1B51.description: Assemble and finish the project according to the specifications of the plan.

D07BA5B4BDA448018D4E9E16C74EBFB8.description: Create the required project components through cutting, shaping, and boring of material.

7337D1D324D441798255D19A62AA6FFA.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency and accuracy with selected layout tools.

F067A1C608B14896995EB8CB9777733F.description: Identify all safety considerations involved with working with others in a limited space as well as strategies for cooperation.

40B8D1C7CAF94878A323B0700B8391A7.description: Identify the most effective methods for completing the chosen project.

5F9DD12452424B3A8CB8232A8C9F4E56.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency to complete a project of one’s own choosing and assess personal skills.

B53F3A6759E7473CBC7959B40B20F79B.description: Investigate the growing trends of residential construction in Saskatchewan such as using straw bales.

8D361BC6795347AE97E6814749E14C70.description: Identify the relative advantages and disadvantages of metal framing versus traditional wood framing.

18B46F58723447FC9B780EB04D0309FA.description: Compare the efficiency advantage of manufacturing building materials to traditional materials (e.g., lifespan, reduction of waste, recycling of materials).

C648F0A4EE234271891C0E8537EFCFB5.description: Research and report on energy efficient and resource efficient alternatives in residential construction.

447D90F02E714946B671FCD1506F81D4.description: Investigate some recent innovations in residential building (e.g., low-E argon windows, insulated concrete forms, recycled plastic decking), and compare them to traditional products and methods.

22FC8149BCB74BA1ACBD85EF1806D534.description: Investigate various innovative building materials and processes and identify their relative advantages or disadvantages over wood and wood products.
